term.title: cause-and-effect diagram

item.text: Diagram indicating the causes of a specific event or condition.

notes.item: In analytical chemistry, Ishikawa diagrams are used to indicate sources of measurement uncertainty. 1. [image]

sources.item: PAC, 2021, 93, 997. 'Metrological and quality concepts in analytical chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 2021)' on page 1021 (https://doi.org/10.1515/pac-2019-0819)

term.citation: Citation: 'cause-and-effect diagram' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.08062
